item.rel_title: Coronavirus disease-19: The First 7,755 Cases in the Republic of Korea
item.rel_abs: We report the first 7,755 patients with confirmed COVID19 in Korea as of March 13, 2020. A total of 66 deaths were identified, resulting case fatality proportion of 0.9%. Older people, and those with coexisting medical conditions were at risk for fatal outcomes. The highest number of cases were from Daegu, followed by Gyeongbuk, with elevated age-stratified case fatality. This summary may help to understand the disease dynamics in the early phase of COVID19 outbreak, therefore, to guide future public health measures.
item.rel_authors: COVID-19 National Emergency Response Center Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, ; Choe, Y. J.
